pages.text: A whole slew of new potions can be made using ingredients you may find in your travels.$(br2)This entry serves to catalogue all of them for your perusal.
When the effect of this potion runs out, whichever entity had it will explode!$(br2)Probably not something you want on yourself, make an arrow out of it perhaps.
Any entities under the effect of this potion will be unable to swim, and will sink instead.
If you find herding animals troublesome, simply have a swig of this potion, and they'll all come following you.

While under the effect of this potion, items will jump into your inventory from much further away.$(br2)You may negate this effect by pressing $(item)$(k:Toggle Magnetism Suppressor)$() on your keyboard.
Any entities under the effect of this potion will crumble away any dirt, sand, gravel, or stone blocks under them.
Players under this effect will regenerate hunger points while under the sunlight.$(br2)Turns out sunlight isn't very saturating though, so make sure to actually eat something too.
Dying under the effect of this potion keeps your potion effects on you.$(br2)If you want to not bring the negative ones with you as well, make sure to upgrade it.
Any players under the effect of this potion will gain additional experience.
This potion will prevent anything infused with its effect from flying. Shoot it at a ghast for some fun times.
Players affected with this potion will row their boat at incredible speeds, allowing them to sail through the oceans faster than ever.
Drinking this potion will make it so that any areas around in which mobs can spawn will have particles coming out of them.
This is just the vanilla Haste effect, but with a recipe!$(br2)Additionally, you can toss a Fermented Spider Eye into it to annoy your friends with Mining Fatigue.
This is also just the vanilla Resistance effect, again, with a recipe.
